Low fat yogurt and its effects on breast cancer

Summary generated using: $shovel3 query.concatConclusions 'breast cancer low fat yogurt site:ncbi.nlm.nih.gov' 40 includeReference=True
  • Dairy consumption is not strongly related to breast cancer risk in this prospective study. A non-significant negative association between calcium intake and breast cancer risk was seen, particularly among premenopausal women.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
    • Link to article
  • Given the results, improving skills, training and awareness is necessary for women and emphasis on modified diet is recommended as a non-medical option for prevention of breast cancer.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
    • Link to article
  • These pilot data suggest that a KD is suitable for even advanced cancer patients. It has no severe side effects and might improve aspects of quality of life and blood parameters in some patients with advanced metastatic tumors.
    • Journal:

  • Our results suggest that an increase in sweet foods or sugar-sweetened beverage intake is associated with higher MD.
